job.title: MuleSoft Developer
job.industry: Nonprofit Organization Management,Government Administration,Hospital & Health Care
job.description: strongIntroductionbrbrstrongstrongAbout The AuthoritybrstrongThe State of Connecticut  Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance Authority the Authority is a quasigovernmental agency formed by statute and signed into law by Governor Ned Lamont in 2019 Its mission is to help Connecticuts workforce navigate health challenges and life changes with greater financial securitybrbrThrough a trust funded by employees the Authority makes benefits payments to eligible employees when either the employee or their family member takes a leave from work to care for themselves or a family memberbrbrbrstrongThe RolebrstrongWe are looking for an experienced MuleSoft Developer The MuleSoft Developer works in partnership with the Product Owner IT Solution Architect and IT Solution Manager and is responsible for the technical designs development of solutions and coordination of and execution of deployment activities This is a fulltime 40 hours per week Monday through Friday positionbrbrbrstrongSelection PlanbrbrstrongstrongPlease ensure that your application is complete and you have included a resume within the Resume Tab of your applicationbrstrongThe minimum experience and training requirements must be met by the close date on the job opening unless otherwise specifiedbrbrThis posting may require completion of additional referral questions RQs which will be sent to you via email after the closing date The email notification will include an expiration date by which you must submit Finish your responses Please regularly check your email for notifications Please check your SPAM andor Junk folders as emails could end up there in errorbrbrThe immediate vacancy is listed above however applications to this recruitment may be used for future vacancies in this job classbrbrInterviews will be limited to candidates whose experience most closely meet the preferred requirements of the position Applicants invited to interview may be required to submit additional documentation which supports their qualifications for this position These documents may include performance reviews supervisory references college transcripts licensure etc at the discretion of the hiring agencybrbrPlease Note You will be unable to make revisions once you submit your application for this posting to the JobAps systembrbrShould you have questions pertaining to this recruitment please contact Jennifer Neumann at jenniferneumannctgov and reference the recruitment numberbrbrbrstrongEXAMPLES OF DUTIESbrstrongExamples of Dutiesbrulli Act as a goto MuleSoft expert  providing MuleSoft technical advice design direction and leadership to all team members to advance the project liliPromote best practices and standards for code and system management liliWorks with Business Analysts and Architects to design solutions for business problems and evaluate requirements for implementation in MuleSoft liliDesign build and configure applications to meet business processes and application requirements liliParticipate in peer for code reviews and unit testingliliProvides application support by analyzing defects replicatingfixing defects and providing root cause analysis for defects liliTroubleshoots and resolves functional and performancerelated issues liliSupport post deployment activities including knowledge transfer process documentation and application bug fixes liul This list of duties is not intended to be allinclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities that the Authority may deem necessary from time to time and as the Authoritys work and responsibilities demandbrbrbrstrongPreferred QualificationsbrbrstrongstrongThe preferred candidate will havebrstrongulliBachelors degree in Computer Science Information Systems or equivalent education or work experience lili3 years experience with endtoend design and development of services for the MuleSoft framework including flows connectors DataWeave exception handling and RESTful API Modeling Language RAML design lili3 years experience with Java Web Services both Simple Object Access Protocol SOAP and Representational State Transfer REST and authentication methods such as Open Authorization OAuth and Security Assertion Markup Language SAML liliExperience in Continuous integration and Continuous deployment liliExperience in source control management using Geographic Information Technology GIT such as Bitbucket liliExperience with Service Oriented Architectures SOAliul strongAdditional Consideration will be givenbrstrongulliCandidates with MuleSoft Certified Developer certifications liliExperience with the agile software development liliExperience with Salesforce Service Cloudliul strongOther Key SkillsbrstrongulliExperience leveraging interpersonal skills to work cohesively as part of a team to deliver excellent results and maintain a collegial work environmentlili Experience providing verbal and written communication to vendors coworkers management and third parties liliDemonstrated ability to share authority and responsibility in high stakes complex and fastmoving work environment liliExperience exercising project and time management skills including a high level of organization attention to detail and followthrough while balancing and prioritizing multiple activities and responsibilitiesliliExperience exercising relationshipbuilding skills and ability to inspire collaboration including success in working in teams projects and people towards action through persuasion liliDemonstrated experience engaging in creative problem solving and taking initiative while utilizing a solutionsoriented approach and exhibiting flexibility and good judgement in a complex organizational ecosystem brbrbrliulstrongConclusionbrbrstrongstrongAN AFFIRMATIVE ACTIONEQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYERbrstrongThe State of Connecticut is an equal opportunityaffirmative action employer and strongly encourages the applications of women minorities and persons with disabilities
